intro: Argostemma callitrichum, commonly known as the small-flowered argostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
